questions.question_text:
A project team recommends accepting the residual risk associated with known regulatory control deficiencies. Which of the following is the risk practitioner's
MOST important recommendation to the project manager?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Agree with B. Tied to regulatory matters, you want control deficiencies remediated before the auditors / regulators find it!

The risk practitioner's MOST important recommendation to the project manager when a project team recommends accepting the residual risk associated with known regulatory control deficiencies is to assess the risk of the remaining deficiencies and develop an action plan (Option B).

While all options may be important, assessing the risk of the remaining deficiencies and developing an action plan is the MOST important recommendation to the project manager in this scenario. This will ensure that the organization has a clear understanding of the potential impact of the remaining deficiencies and can take appropriate action to mitigate the associated risks.

choices.D: Confirm a timeline to remediate the remaining deficiencies after the project goes live.
choices.A: Present the remaining deficiencies to the project steering committee for sign-off.
choices.B: Assess the risk of the remaining deficiencies and develop an action plan.
choices.C: Update the project risk register with the remaining deficiencies and remediation actions.

discussion.content:

Which of the following is the BEST recommendation of a risk practitioner for an organization that recently changed its organizational structure?

choices.C: Review and adjust key risk indicators (KRIs).
choices.D: Implement a new risk assessment process.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Going with A.

i am going with A but i think it will be B:
The BEST recommendation of a risk practitioner for an organization that recently changed its organizational structure is to communicate the new risk profile (Option B).

Organizational changes can have a significant impact on an organization's risk profile. Therefore, it is important to communicate the new risk profile to stakeholders, including senior management, employees, and other relevant parties. This will help ensure that everyone understands the potential impact of the organizational change on the organization's risk exposure.

Selected Answer: A
Answer should be A: Re-validate the corporate risk appetite. As mentioned in the book, "Risk appetite and tolerances change over time, and a variety of factors such as new technology, organizational restructuring, or changes in business strategy may require the enterprise to reassess its risk portfolio and reconfirm its risk appetite.
